events.description: A trade agreement between India and the US that removed market overhang and boosted foreign inflows.
A worldwide decline in technology stocks related to artificial intelligence affecting global markets.

events.event_name: Indian private sector growth data release
events.description: Final figures for Indian private sector growth showing a downward revision but remaining robust.

facts.fact_text: The BSE Sensex rose 79 points, or 0.1%, to 83,818 in Wednesday morning trade.

evidences.evidence_text: The BSE Sensex rose 79 points, or 0.1%, to 83,818 in Wednesday morning trade

facts.fact_text: The Indian tech sector plunged 5.2%, led by declines in Infosys, TCS, HCL Tech, and Tech Mahindra.

evidences.evidence_text: the tech sector plunging 5.2%, mainly weighed down by Infosys (-6.1%), TCS (-5.2%), HCL Tech (-4.6%), and Tech Mahindra (-4.2%)

facts.fact_text: Indian private sector growth was revised lower but remained robust in manufacturing and services.

evidences.evidence_text: final figures showed that Indian private sector growth was revised lower but remained robust, supported by stronger growth in both manufacturing and services

claims.claim_text: Optimism over US-India trade deals is fueling market sentiment.

evidences.evidence_text: optimism over US–India trade deals continued to fuel sentiment

claims.claim_text: The global sell-off in AI-linked tech stocks capped the gains of the broader Indian market.

evidences.evidence_text: a global sell-off in AI-linked tech stocks capped gains

evidence.evidence_text: the India–US trade deal removed a key market overhang and boosted foreign inflows

links.source_ref: global sell-off in AI-linked tech stocks

evidence.evidence_text: a global sell-off in AI-linked tech stocks capped gains, with the tech sector plunging 5.2%
final figures showed that Indian private sector growth was revised lower but remained robust
